mdRecord.dcterms:description: Harbour Court was built in 1904-1906 by Cram, Goodhue & Ferguson (Boston) for the widow of John Nicholas Brown I. An 8-acre estate overlooking Newport Harbor, Harbour Court includes a large house, two small wood-frame buildings, an ample garage and service quarters, a greenhouse, and a significant landscape, all set behind a tile-capped stucco wall. http://wikimapia.org/129070/NYYC-Harborcourt Harbour Court remained in the Brown family until the late 1980s; in 1987 it became the Newport clubhouse of the New York Yacht Club. http://www.nyyc.org/clubhouse/ [work]
